sen.j: 東園家（ひがしそのけ）は園基任の次男東園基教（従四位上近衛府）を祖とする堂上家である。
sen.e: The Higashisono family was founded by Motonori HIGASHISONO (Jushiinojo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade), the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), who was the second son of Mototada SONO (or Mototo SONO).
The Higashisono family was founded by Motonori HIGASHISONO (Jushiinojo - Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade, Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), the second son of Mototada SONO (or Mototo SONO).
The Higashisono family was founded by Motonori HIGASHISONO (Jushiinojo - Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade, Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), the second son of Mototada SONO (or Mototo SONO).
The family rank was Urinke.
The family rank was Urinke.
The family rank was Urinke.

sen.j: 極官は基教の養子東園基賢以降、大納言を極官とする。
sen.e: After the Motonori's adopted son Motokata HIGASHISONO, the highest attainable position was Dainagon (Major Counselor).
After Motonori's adopted son Motokata HIGASHISONO, the highest attainable position was Dainagon (Major Counselor).
After Motonori's adopted son Motokata HIGASHISONO, the highest attainable position was Dainagon (Major Counselor).
The family inherited the hereditary art of performance of sacred music and dance 'Kagurado'.
The family inherited the hereditary art of performing sacred music and dancing 'Kagurado'.
The family inherited the hereditary art of performing sacred music and dancing Kagurado.
Motokata served as imperial secretary 'Giso' to the emperor.
Motokata served as imperial secretary 'Giso' to the emperor.
Motokata served as imperial secretary Giso to the emperor.
The stipend during the Edo period was 180 koku.
The stipend during the Edo period was 180 koku.
The stipend during the Edo period was 180 koku.

sen.j: 明治時代、東園基愛は子爵を賜った。
sen.e: During the Meiji period, Motoyuki HIGASHISONO was bestowed the title of ｖiscount.
During the Meiji period, Motoyuki HIGASHISONO was bestowed the title of ｖiscount.
During the Meiji period, Motoyuki HIGASHISONO was bestowed the title of viscount.
